Articles.Content: So I was designing something when I realised that I don't actually have the parts to do what I was planning. All the cargo bays from B9 are of course designed mostly for planes and don't really contain an ideal cargo bay for rockets. Is there a mod out there that would fill this little void in my arsenal? Searches haven't been turning up any results. Ideally I'm looking for cargo bays up to 3.75 metres

Oh, I've found a collegue!

Try to search for "Wolfpack Aeronautics". There are 3 sizes of cargo bays, an extender for pushing stuff and some kind of custom docking port, which should be no-wobble ( regarding to description )

Problem is that those parts arent inegrated in techtree. And yes, they also arent adapted for FAR and DRE, so be careful. If you'll neÃÂµd a config - poke me with PM

Like this http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/lsi-spacejunk-cargo-bay http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/19767-0-17-10-09-LSI-Part-list-Spacejunk-Bay ?

It is very old! (0.17 stuff!) but as it is only parts should still work. I have not played KSP 0.17. I used it on newer oldies KSP ;D

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/77505-Cargo-Transportation-Solutions-%28WIP%29

This one's kind of neat. Mostly parts based on NASA's Constellation program ideas.
Try this http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-20-2-5m-sliding-cargo-bay-wayland-corp/ . It's small but cool

DaMichel has a very nice looking cargo bay of various lengths.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61345-WIP-DaMichels-Parts-%283-06-2014%29-%28was-spherical-tanks%29

The Wolfpack cargobay is a rework of the old Spacejunk cargo bay.
You can look at 6S Service Compartment Tubes. Someone made extra large versions to go with them. They aren't QUITE cargo bays, but they work great, and for small payloads work perfectly.
I cant believe that nobody has suggested that rockets use fairings instead of cargo bays.
